title: Identify the Verb Tense
instruction: Identify which verb tense (present, past, future, or imperative) is used in each sentence from classical Buddhist texts.

questions.question: What tense is བལྟས in: སྤྱན་རས་གཟིགས་ཀྱིས་ཕུང་པོ་ལྔ་སྟོང་པར་བལྟས། (Avalokiteshvara ___ the five aggregates as empty.) [Heart Sutra]
questions.transliteration: spyan ras gzigs kyis phung po lnga stong par bltas
questions.english: Avalokiteshvara ___ the five aggregates as empty.

options.transliteration: bltas is the past stem of blta (to look)
future would be blta (same as present)

questions.question: What tense is བྱེད in: རྒྱལ་སྲས་ཀྱིས་སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་དོན་བྱེད། (The bodhisattva ___ for sentient beings' benefit.) [37 Practices]
questions.transliteration: rgyal sras kyis sems can gyi don byed
questions.english: The bodhisattva ___ for sentient beings' benefit.

options.transliteration: byed is the present stem of 'to do'

questions.question: What tense is སྤོངས in: བདག་འཛིན་སྤོངས། (___ self-grasping!) [37 Practices]

options.transliteration: spongs is the imperative stem of spong
past would be bspangs (with b- prefix)

questions.question: What tense is བཏབ in: ཀུན་ཏུ་བཟང་པོས་སྨོན་ལམ་བཏབ། (Samantabhadra ___ aspiration prayers.) [Samantabhadra's Prayer]
questions.transliteration: kun tu bzang pos smon lam btab

options.transliteration: btab is the past stem of 'debs (to set forth)

questions.question: What tense is བསྒྲུབ in: བདག་གིས་འགྲོ་བ་ཀུན་གྱི་དོན་བསྒྲུབ། (I ___ the benefit of all beings.) [Samantabhadra's Prayer]
questions.transliteration: bdag gis 'gro ba kun gyi don bsgrub
questions.english: I ___ the benefit of all beings.

options.transliteration: bsgrub (with b- prefix, no -s) is the future stem
present would be sgrub (no b- prefix)

correctFeedback: Well done! You can distinguish verb stems in classical Buddhist texts.
incorrectFeedback: Review the stem patterns: present has no prefix, past adds བ- and/or -ས, future adds བ- (no -ས), imperative drops བ- and adds -ས.
